Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Dan McCready "did admit he opposes middle class tax cuts" when in fact he expressed opposition to the tax plan because it didn't do enough to help the middle class.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the article cited does not fully back up the claim that McCready opposes tax cuts for the middle class.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by equating opposition to a specific tax plan with opposition to middle class tax cuts in general.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that McCready's opposition to the tax plan was based on it not doing enough to benefit the middle class, rather than outright opposing middle class tax cuts.
